message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique and valuable product. I think you'll really like it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12000. Is this something you'd like to consider?
I'm interested in the product, but $12000 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand you're on a budget, Bob. However, I have to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to get at least $10000 for the product. Would you be willing to consider that?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product. Can you consider that?

I can see you're really interested in the product, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm thinking of $11000. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I appreciate your flexibility, but $11000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product. Can you consider that?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I really need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm thinking of $10500. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I'm willing to meet you halfway on the price, but I'm still not sure if $10500 is the best fit for me. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product. Can you consider that?

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated, Bob. I've made several concessions already, and I'm still not getting close to my minimum price. I'm willing to make one final offer, but I need to get at least $11000. If not, I'll have to consider other options. Would you be willing to meet me at $11000?
I understand you're trying to get close to your minimum price, but I'm still not willing to pay $11000. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product. This is my final offer.
